body:
Error message:
 Tue Nov 22 10:54:10 UTC 2016: /usr/local/bin/install-traf.sh
 Installing Trafodion Command Interface
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
unzip:  cannot find or open trafci.zip, trafci.zip.zip or trafci.zip.ZIP.
Error: Unable to access jarfile trafciInstaller.jar
ERROR: Could not install Trafodion Command Interface
+ exit 1
Thanks Dave for your comments, I will fix them and resubmit the fix.
There's another JIRA on this subject, https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TRAFODION-114. I will mark that one resolved/fixed when your change is merged in.

Thanks for looking at that, @kevinxu021 
The test jobs that use trafci are trying to install it, but this PR changes the method to install it.

First, the new trafci is not getting included in the clients tar file. See the build artifacts at https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/build-rh6-master-release/528/. So that needs to get fixed. See core/conn/Makefile.
Second, if the trafci installation method needs to cahnge, please let me know so I can update test automation. Posting the info on dev list would be great.

env.TRAFODION_VER should work in the maven pom.xml.  Even though there are some warnings displayed, this convention works. DCS and REST components work this way. Without the "env." the ${TRAFODION_VER} will be evaluated as a local property inside the pom. Not sure how the build worked.
Resolved conflicts and addressed DaveBirdsall and selvaganesang feedback comments. Thank You.

+1

Agree with Dave and Suresh. Maybe you could consider two things:

- In addition to SHA, have a few more functions SHA2_256, SHA2_384, SHA2_512, with a single argument each. Those could be translated in the parser into the original SHA2 function, or you could use the ZZZBinderFunction method in the binder to do the translation. That has the advantage of showing the original function name in EXPLAIN.

- If the second argument is a constant, then synthesize the output type appropriately. Only make it a VARCHAR if the second argument is not a constant.
I think it is good. If @selvaganesang agrees, one of us can merge it.

I would also have preferred to have the output of these functions be in binary format. If they need to be displayed on screen then converttohex function can be used on them. This will result in space savings on both disk and memory. In some sense, the previous PR on these functions has already started us on the current. Is it too late for change the output of these functions? Thank you.

@sureshsubbiah, wouldn't those numbers with >64 bits be very very inconvenient to use, similarly the need to use converttohex would be inconvenient? I've never seen these SHA numbers being used for anything other than displaying and comparing the hex string. Also, MySQL returns a string, see https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/encryption-functions.html#function_sha2

thanks for your comments, @svarnau , i have convert the trafci project into maven project. now the install way is only need to do the make instead of ant. i have changed the core/conn/Makefile, Not sure whereto change the trafci method you mentioned. or only you have privilege to do that. please give suggestion.

hmm, thanks for you comments @venkat1m , Not sure why it did not work, i refered the dbmgr to set the variable, but it failed, then i noticed the   JDBCT4 used TRAFODION_VER, so i want to give a shot.

So you are saying that the result of the build should be same zip file as before?  The end user would not necessarily do a "make". One does a make package to build tarfiles, including the clients tarfile, which should include the trafci.zip file.  If you get that to work, then there should be no changes needed to the test automation.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/1401/
Thank you all for the comments. I think I have a solution to make it return a fixed length result. I will update it.
@svarnau , @gtapper do you have concerns from license point of view of merging this PR?
please file a JIRA to track that document update for this PR is required. Then I will be good for this PR .

I have added a commit to make the return values be the fixed length char.

For the second operand , I use NUMERIC_LITERAL_EXACT_NO_SCALE instead of value_expression. Here is a problem than we can't use dynamic statement like "prepare s1 from select sha2(?, ?) from dual". 

I think the new change make the code looks not clean. So If some of you think the changes can't be commited, I can roll back it.
In good shape from license file view.

+1

This is a good solution, in my humble opinion.

+1

Looks good to me. Happy Thanksgiving!
Wow... fastest code review I've ever received. And Happy Thanksgiving to you, too, @zellerh.
Can you please add some basic junit testcase for trafci

This PR change was attributed to DamagedWalException (DEW) seen in region server (RS) logs in Esgyn internal testing. This is primarily a client side change except that co-processors are always added as the table attribute when a trafodion table is created.  Prior to this change, the coprocessors are added when the attribute hbase.coprocessor.region.classes is not visible on the client side. This is the case with CDH distro. However, the service side configuration should continue to see the attribute hbase.coprocessor.region.classes set to regionObserver, endpoint coprocessor and AggregateCoprocesor classes both in CDH and HDP distros. It is possible that RS can be influenced in some way due to double loading of these classes. But, it was confirmed by @narendragoyal  that the DWE is seen even when the coprocessor is not added as the table attribute. 

I read the change again to check if something is amiss with this change. I couldn't find anything.  Reviewers/Contributors, can you please review this change again to determine what can possibly DWE due to the change.
@hegdean as for this kind of project transfer, not sure how to add junit. you know it's not related to feature, even code. could you give some guide.

There has been a lot of email recently on general incubator and legal lists.  The JSon license has been clarified, here is a recap from Apache legal:


> >>>  o No new project, sub-project or codebase, which has not

> >>>    used JSON licensed jars (or similar), are allowed to use

> >>>    them. In other words, if you haven't been using them, you

> >>>    aren't allowed to start. It is Cat-X.

> >>>

> >>>  o If you have been using it, and have done so in a *release*,

> >>>    AND there has been NO pushback from your community/eco-system,

> >>>    you have a temporary exclusion from the Cat-X classification thru

> >>>    April 30, 2017. At that point in time, ANY and ALL usage

> >>>    of these JSON licensed artifacts are DISALLOWED. You must

> >>>    either find a suitably licensed replacement, or do without.

> >>>    There will be NO exceptions.

> >>>

> >>>  o Any situation not covered by the above is an implicit

> >>>    DISALLOWAL of usage.

> >>>

> >>> Also please note that in the 2nd situation (where a temporary

> >>> exclusion has been granted), you MUST ensure that NOTICE explicitly

> >>> notifies the end-user that a JSON licensed artifact exists. They

> >>> may not be aware of it up to now, and that MUST be addressed.

> >>>

> >>> If there are any questions, please ask on the legal-discuss@a.o<mailto:legal-discuss@a.o>

> >>> list.

> >>>

> >>> --

> >>> Jim Jagielski

> >>> VP Legal Affairs

I notice that the license for the include files you are BSD which should be fine. I don’t believe you are using any JSON jar files so perhaps the license change does not affect us or Postgres.  However, INAL and cannot state positively that we are okay.  Should we ask for a clarification from the legal list?

    Roberta

Can you please add test cases

Looks good to me too. I saw some $ZUUL_BRANCH stuff in there a few lines above one of your changes. I'm wondering if that stuff is obsolete. (And, yes, I know that's outside the scope of what you're trying to do with this change.)

+1
Looks good to me (with the fix you mentioned).

@rwbzx we are not supposed to just put the code files as attachment, the test code also should be under control of git. However, we don't have a proper place to put these code yet, or just say we don't have an agreement yet where to place.
@hegdean we can have a discuss about this later, we can go ahead to review this fix, no need to make it bigger.

The indention looks good now this time. I anything still goes wrong, please point out.

@andyyangcn , you need to fix the conflicts

Do a 'git pull' and fix the merge issue, and commit again.
Related to the ZUUL_BRANCH, I checked with the install group and this information is still required for our build environment.

Agreed that the test code should be added to version control. License statements need to be added to files. If they are windows platform specific, they can be added as a new test directory under win-odbc64, yes?
Otherwise, maybe under core/conn/trafci?
I need to fix the conflict, must forgot to rebase before modifying the code. I should finish one change in one PR.
I will submit a new PR for this update, please not merge this one, use this PR as a reference of code review only.
As a first step you should just add test code  to version control under win-odbc64  with instructions on how to run it manually.

win-odbc64 would not be a proper place, these tests are not only for windows, but linux as well. I prefer put them under dcs/src/test. @rwbzx would you please make these test codes runable on both Windows and Linux? The make file, project file, building script would also be workable.
